item.description:
A Trip to Salem is my favorite thing to do!

This will be our 2nd annual trip to Salem-
We had a great time last year, but
we will be doing things a little bit different this year-

People can meet in Salem at 1:00 pm, at the House of Seven Gables parking lot,
(where we will proceed to the parking garage)



or dinner at Victoria Station at 5pm, and the ghost tour after that-

People who want to show up at 1pm, can follow me as a tour guide, and go on
various tours, or do their own thing until it is time to meet.

Dinner will be at my favorite Salem Restaurant Victoria Station at 5:00 pm, which is on the wharf, and specializes in Prime Rib and Sea Food- They have a wide variety of selections on their menu which you can check out at:

http://www.victoriast...

After dinner, we will head over to The Salem Night Ghost Tour which is a lantern-led stroll down Salem' s
historic, shadowy streets, and discover the ghosts, the witches, and the legends of this haunted city!

This is a 90 minute tour which is $9.00 per person and NOT alot of walking, but alot of ghostly haunts!

I recently talked the owner who showed me a picture of one of the places we will visit, and there was this AWESOME picture of a little girl ghost running across the room, that showed up clearly in the picture!
You can see information here:

http://74.125.95.132/...

Some other things you can do:

The Salem Trolley Tour
(reccomended if you come for the day and park in the mall)

This will take you on a 45 min tour of historic Salem & will also take you and drop you off at all the sites and shops you want to see

http://74.125.95.132/...

Some noted places you might want to visit are as follows:


The Witch Dungeons

The original site of the witch dungeons is actually below the phone company, however, they have re-created the dungeons to the specific measurements of the actual dungeons.

The tour at the witch dungeons starts out with everyone going into the theater to read the story of the Salem witch trials on the plaques on the walls. Then there is a mini play, of a re-creation of an actual trial taken from real manuscripts that were found in the last several years. The play is done with the accusers and accused on stage, and the people in the crowd treated as those from Salem Town attending the trial.
After the play, the tour guide will give some facts of what happened in Salem in 1692, and then everyone is taken down into the re-creation of the dungeons, to see how big the cells were, and the re-creation of things that happened. The tour ends in the gift shop, and pictures can be taken in the pillorys outside.

Link for the witch dungeons:

http://74.125.95.132/...

The House of Seven Gables at:

http://www.7gables.or...


You can do some "witchy" shopping at:

Laurie Cabot's, the famous witch of Salem's current shop:

http://www.lauriecabo...

Artemisia Botanicals
A great shop to stock up on reasonably priced herbs at:

http://74.125.95.132/...

The pagan singer Gypsy's Shop- Nu Aeon at:

http://74.125.95.132/...

Then to the famous Pyramid Books:

http://74.125.95.132/...

The best candy store in New England, Ye Olde Pepper Companie for homemade chocolates and candy- You can check out that link at:

http://74.125.95.132/...

Laurie Cabot's first shop Crow Haven Corner-
Check out the link at:

http://74.125.95.132/...

One of my favorites,
The Broom Closet:

http://74.125.95.132/...

The Angel Shop:

http://www.angelicaof...

Hex at:

http://74.125.95.132/...


Bring lots of money to spend, and expect to have a great time! :
item.how_to_find_us: Meet in the parking lot at the Gables at 1pm towards the street
item.name: Trip to Salem/ Ghost Tour
